question: India successfully test fired its Agni-III ballistic missile from Abdul Kalam Island off Odisha coast. It is powered by ___ stage solid propellant engine.
explanation: India successfully test-fired 3000 kilometre range Agni-III ballistic missile from Abdul Kalam Island off Odisha coast. The test was aimed at re-establishing the operational effectiveness of the weapon system. It is powered by a two-stage solid propellant engine with a length of 17 metres, the missile's diameter is 2 metres and weight is around 2200 kilograms.
